column25:
I think the way the collector is built, is the reason why the documentation is spread amongst the Readme files.

The main documentation site should maybe gather the markdown files and bring them to a single documentation site. 

once we know how the collector works, after a week or two of hard digging, the component''s documentation is enough. 

The main documentation site is mostly for beginners.

column22: Stability, A better development onboarding experience when writing custom components for the Collector. We prefer to place logs (eventually all telemetry) onto NATS, which needed a custom exporter. The experience of learning the best/most recent patterns to follow in the Collector was _extremely_ painful. We would have really benefitted from some updated, quick reading about the golden path for writing custom exporters. We got there eventually but had to look through mostly GH issues to better understand the direction the community is taking.
column25: As mentioned in a previous answer, a better experience for those wishing to extend the Collector. The current https://opentelemetry.io/docs/collector/building/ and subpages are not quite adequate when wanting to author custom components in a sustainable, blessed way. This would require the Collector to be more or less stable in terms of interfaces and design though, and I understand what is sustainable and blessed may change week to week :)
